snippet: At least 73 people have died since Friday amid heavy rains in two states in the country’s east, disaster management officials said.
abstract: Disaster management officials in India report at least 73 deaths due to flooding and landslide caused by rains in West Bengal and Manipur States; conditions, sending thousands to refugee and medical camps, called for deployment of almost 700 emergency workers.
lead_paragraph: At least 73 people have died since Friday amid heavy rains in two states in the country’s east, disaster management officials said.

headline.main: Flooding and a Landslide Kill Dozens Amid India Monsoons
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; India: Deaths in East Tied to Rains
